get.summary: Get a list of fixed assets

parameters.name: X-Requesting-System
parameters.description: Identifying the system calling the service.

parameters.name: X-Requesting-User
parameters.description: Identifying the user calling the service.

parameters.name: X-Flow-ID
parameters.description: Optional technical Id (GUID) for call identification.

parameters.name: X-Client-Type
parameters.description: Optional client type calling the service.
Optional search string for looking up a record within name and search term fields.
parameters.name: searchString
skip
parameters.description: Number of records to skip for pagination.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return.

parameters.name: changesSinceDateTime
parameters.description: Get all the entities which were added/edited after a specific date and time. Cannot be used together with search\r\nparameters (searchString, fixedAssetNo, externalFixedAssetNo).

parameters.name: changesSinceChangeId
parameters.description: Get all the entities which were added/edited after a specific change id. Cannot be used together with search\r\nparameters (searchString, fixedAssetNo, externalFixedAssetNo).

parameters.name: fixedAssetNo
parameters.description: Retrieve a specific record by internal fixed asset. Ignores other search options if provided.

parameters.name: externalFixedAssetNo
parameters.description: Retrieve a specific record by external fixed asset. Ignores other search options if provided.

parameters.name: origin
parameters.description: Get all the entities of a certain origin

parameters.name: X-Requesting-System
parameters.description: Identifying the system calling the service.

parameters.name: X-Requesting-User
parameters.description: Identifying the user calling the service.

parameters.name: X-Flow-ID
parameters.description: Optional technical Id (GUID) for call identification.

parameters.name: X-Client-Type
parameters.description: Optional client type calling the service.
Optional search string for looking up a record within name and search term fields.
parameters.name: searchString
skip
parameters.description: Number of records to skip for pagination.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return.

parameters.name: changesSinceDatetime
parameters.description: Get all the entities which were added/edited since a specific datetime. Cannot be used together with search\r\nparameters (searchString, internalOrderId,\r\nexternalOrderId).

parameters.name: changesSinceChangeId
parameters.description: Get all the entities which were added/edited since a specific OrderId. Cannot be used together with search\r\nparameters (searchString, internalOrderId,\r\nexternalOrderId).

parameters.name: internalOrderId
parameters.description: Retrieve a specific record by internal order Id. Ignores other search options if provided.

parameters.name: externalOrderId
parameters.description: Retrieve a specific record by external order Id. Ignores other search options if provided.

parameters.name: orderType
parameters.description: Get all the entities of a certain order type (M: Material P: Production V: Sales E: Purchase A: Other)

parameters.name: origin
parameters.description: Get all the entities of a certain origin

put.summary:
Updates an existing base order if internal or external Id match.
Creates a base order if neither internal or external Id is provided or no matching record could be found

parameters.name: X-Requesting-System
parameters.description: Identifying the system calling the service.

parameters.name: X-Requesting-User
parameters.description: Identifying the user calling the service.

parameters.name: X-Flow-ID
parameters.description: Optional technical Id (GUID) for call identification.

parameters.name: X-Client-Type
parameters.description: Optional client type calling the service.

put.description:
Updates an existing order if internal or external Id match.
Creates an order if neither internal or external Id is provided or no matching record could be found.

origin.description: The system of origin the order

originId.description: Id of the system of origin the order

modifyUser.description: Name of user who changed relevant information of the record

modifyDate.description: Date someone changed relevant information of the record

fixedAssetNo.description: The fixed asset number uniquely identifies a fixed asset in performis. To identify a fixed asset, either the performis fixed asset no (fixedAssetNo) or the Id of the external system (externalFixedAssetNo) is required.

externalFixedAssetNo.description: Third-party fixed asset number - This Id must be unique within the origin (Origin field). As Id it is recommended to use either the Primary Key of the foreign system or a GUID (Global Unique Identifier). Attention, if External Ids are used, no performis Ids may be used in parallel, additionally the Origin field is mandatory. E.g. Id "629c5d97-a225-4b08-877c-e8a802c23014" for origin "SAP". To identify the fixed asset, either the performis fixed asset no (fixedAssetNo) or the Id of the external system (externalFixedAssetNo) is required.

companyNo.description: The CompanyNo identifies the customer via the corresponding number in the mandate system

description.description: Full decription / Name of the service provider

order.title: Order
order.description: By passing the appropriate option the service get

internalOrderId.description: The order Id uniquely identifies an order in performis. To identify an order, either the performis order Id (OrderId) or the Id of the external system (ExternalOrderId) is required.

externalOrderId.description: Third-party order Id - This Id must be unique within the origin (Origin field). As Id it is recommended to use either the Primary Key of the foreign system or a GUID (Global Unique Identifier). Attention, if External Ids are used, no performis Ids may be used in parallel, additionally the Origin field is mandatory. E.g. Id "629c5d97-a225-4b08-877c-e8a802c23014" for origin "SAP". To identify the business partner, either the performis order (OrderId) or the Id of the external system (ExternalOrderId) is required.

orderNo.description: The OrderNo identifies the order to be booked in accounting. This is the actual order no of the order

companyNo.description: The CompanyNo identifies the customer via the corresponding number in the mandate system

description.description: The Description is a short description / title of the order

internalBpAddrId.description: The BpAddrId references the business partner addess within performis

externalBpAddrId.description: The ExternalBpAddrId references the business partner addess within the customer system

responsiblePerson.description: The person responsable for the order

orderType.description:
The OrderType identifies the type of the order
M: Material
P: Production
V: Sales
E: Purchase
A: Other

origin.description: The system of origin the order

orderStatus.description:
Code that indentfies the current state of the order
1040100: Recorded
1040150: In delivery
1040170: Partially delivered
1040480: Delivered
1040490: Ready for invoicing
1040500: Completed/invoiced
1040600: Deleted

chargingType.description:
Defines whether the order is reallocated
KT: cost unit
KS: cost centre
AU: order

budgetCharging.description: Shows whether the order is relevant to the budget

documentId.description: Id that identifies the stored "physical" document

documentGUID.description: GUID that identifies the stored "physical" document

isManualPost.description: Shows whether the order can be booked in accounting?

companyNo.description: Company no for which the codevalue is available. 0 = all companies

text.description: Description or title of the codevalue

shorttext.description: Short-description or title of the codevalue

attributeSetId.description: performis internal of attribute set Id

attributSetDescription.description: Description / Title of the attribute set

example1.title: Sample Title
example1.detail: This is a generic message to provide a sample return of how a message may be returned.

maintenanceWindow.title: MaintenanceWindow
maintenanceWindow.description: information structure for active maintenance windows

active.description: usually the API will respond with this structure, when the maintenance window is active and the window has started.

clientStartAllowed.description: defines wether or not clients may continue to work while the maintenance window applies.
